intro: Oerstedella tetraceros, commonly known as the four-horned plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive four-lobed leaves that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its rare occurrence and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a lesser-known but ecologically significant botanical species.
